quote_last: pulled into Tunbridge Wells on time, and William was the first person off the train. He joined the little posse awaiting him.
quote_raw: The 14.43 pulled into Tunbridge Wells on time, and William was the first person off the train. He joined the little posse awaiting him.
title: Over My Dead Body
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote_first: Right! Let's get on with it. You know what we want, a full account of where you were, what you were doing, and whom you saw between one o'clock when lunch was over and
quote_last: when Miss Gray found the body.
quote_raw: Right! Let's get on with it. You know what we want, a full account of where you were, what you were doing, and whom you saw between one o'clock when lunch was over and two-forty-three when Miss Gray found the body.
title: The Skull Beneath the Skin
author: P.D. James

quote_last: Vance watched the control room freeze as the body slumped to the floor, and he felt his fingers involuntarily bunch into a fist. The bastards were killing hostages already. They definitely were terrorists, right out of the textbook. Kill one, and frighten a thousand. Except they might not stop with one. He foresaw a long day. And night.
quote_raw:
2:43 P.M.
Vance watched the control room freeze as the body slumped to the floor, and he felt his fingers involuntarily bunch into a fist. The bastards were killing hostages already. They definitely were terrorists, right out of the textbook. Kill one, and frighten a thousand. Except they might not stop with one. He foresaw a long day. And night.
title: Project Cyclops
author: Thomas Hoover

quote_last: the next day after slashing his wrists with a razor blade in the second cubicle from the left in the men's washroom on the third floor.
quote_raw: Jacobson died at 2.43 pm the next day after slashing his wrists with a razor blade in the second cubicle from the left in the men's washroom on the third floor.
title: Now: Zero
author: J.G. Ballard

quote_first: Then he began to breathe more freely; “the girl,” as he always mentally dubbed her, could not enter the grounds now without his seeing her. He looked at his watch for the third time—
quote_last: . Just about the time he had planned. She should be here soon if she had left Miss Lloyd’s a little after two.
quote_raw: Then he began to breathe more freely; “the girl,” as he always mentally dubbed her, could not enter the grounds now without his seeing her. He looked at his watch for the third time—seventeen minutes to three. Just about the time he had planned. She should be here soon if she had left Miss Lloyd’s a little after two.
title: Silverthorns
author: Mary Louisa Molesworth
